intro.description: This Cheat Sheet will help you to deploy a Data Intensive Application in the test bed. This tool is currently externally integrated, so the main functionality remains in an external web server

item.title: Install the DICE Deployment Service
item.description: Before running the Deployment Tool from the IDE, you need to install the DICE deployment service within a server. You can find the full instructions in the following link: https://github.com/dice-project/DICE-Deployment-Service/wiki/Installation

item.title: Create a container for the IDE
item.description: A new container should be created for the IDE. You can find the instructions in the following link: https://github.com/dice-project/DICE-Deployment-Service/wiki/Installation#container-management

item.title: Configure the tool connection in the IDE
item.description: Before launching the tool, you need to check the connection properties to the configured server

subitem.label: Open the preferences page of the Delivery Tool (Window -> Preferences -> Deployment Tools)
Check the attributes of the preferences page and modify the values properly. This values are used when launching the tool

item.title: Open a TOSCA blueprint
item.description: You need to download some TOSCA blueprint examples. Depending on if you're using OpenStack or FCO, you may download one example or other. You can do it by cloning the whole repository. Import or copy the downloaded blueprint into your project

subitem.label: If you're using OpenStack, take the files from the folder "storm/storm-openstack.yaml"
If you're using FCO, take the files from the folder "storm/storm-fco.yaml"

item.title: Open a Deployment Service panel
item.description: As the tool is externally integrated, the execution is very easy. Simply click on the menu "Deployment Service -> DICE Deployments Tool UI", and the web server will be opened

subitem.label: Log into the DICE deployment service using your username and password.

item.title: Deploy your blueprint
item.description: Follow these steps to deploy your blueprint. These steps should be performed in the opened web browser

subitem.label: In the DICE - Deployment Service panel, click on the Upload Blueprint.
In the file dialog, select your .yaml blueprint file and confirm the selection to close the dialog.
Click the Upload button that appears.
Wait for the deployment to finish. This may take several minutes or longer. If all goes well, the DICE - Deployment Service will show a "Blueprint successfully deployed" message.
